com.google.common.io

Class ByteBufferDataInputStream

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.io.InputStream
      • com.google.common.io.ByteBufferDataInputStream
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, DataInput, AutoCloseable

    public class ByteBufferDataInputStream
extends InputStream
implements DataInput
    Wrapper from ByteBuffer to an InputStream and the DataInput interface, converting unchecked exceptions from underlying ByteBuffer calls to appropriate checked IOExceptions.

    The byte ordering used depends on the ordering set by ByteBuffer.order(ByteOrder). If that is explicitly set to ByteOrder.LITTLE_ENDIAN, that will be the ordering of returned values spanning more than one byte.

    While useful for typical memory buffers, this may be especially useful for MappedByteBuffer instances. This class was taken from http://code.google.com/p/guava-libraries/issues/detail?id=592.

    Author:
    Todd Vierling
